title: Dental Materials Troubleshooting
description: Flip each card to review common dental materials issues, recommended responses, and QA follow ups for Module 5.

dialogs.text:
Alginate Tear-Out

Your impression shows torn vestibular tissue tags and distorted anterior surfaces.
dialogs.answer:
Response

  • Likely removed tray before set or trapped tissue due to rocking.
  • Mix with cooler water to extend working time, seat posterior first, and support tray during removal.
  • Document defect and repeat before disinfecting for the lab.

dialogs.text:
Gypsum Cast Voids

Facial surfaces on the pour show pinhole voids and chalky texture.
dialogs.answer:
Response

  • Air was introduced while pouring or impression was contaminated.
  • Use vibration to flow stone slowly, rinse and disinfect impression thoroughly, and separate only after final set.
  • Record batch number and note corrective action on QA log.

dialogs.text:
Amalgam Marginal Fracture

Day-after check reveals ditching at the proximal box of a new restoration.
dialogs.answer:
Response

  • Insufficient condensation or premature carving is likely.
  • Increase condensation pressure, use small condensers near margins, and burnish properly before carving.
  • Review spill kits and mercury hygiene when remixing.

dialogs.text:
Composite Pull-Back

Class II composite exhibits gaps on the axial wall after finishing.
dialogs.answer:
Response

  • Dentin overdried or adhesive undercured.
  • Maintain moist dentin, scrub adhesive for full dwell time, air-thin gently, and check curing light irradiance >1000 mW/cmÂ².
  • Log light output in maintenance chart.

dialogs.text:
Provisional Open Contact

Temporary crown returns from bite check with food impaction and open mesial contact.
dialogs.answer:
Response

  • Matrix not contoured or bis-acryl trimmed excessively.
  • Burnish matrix before relining, add flowable resin to contact, finish/polish, and re-check floss resistance.
  • Update provisional record with material lot and adjustments.

dialogs.text:
SDS Follow-Up

A new glass ionomer batch arrives without a digital Safety Data Sheet link.
dialogs.answer:
Response

  • Quarantine material until SDS obtained.
  • Contact manufacturer for PDF, upload to shared SDS folder, and label storage bin with QR code.
  • Note action on hazard communication checklist.
